diff_hunk:
@@ -94,3 +94,42 @@ endif()
 if(WIN32)
   add_dependencies(tensorflow tensorflow_static)
 endif(WIN32)
+
+install(TARGETS tensorflow
+        RUNTIME DESTINATION bin
+        LIBRARY DESTINATION lib
+        ARCHIVE DESTINATION lib)
+
+# install headers
+get_property(include_dirs DIRECTORY ${CMAKE_CURRENT_SOURCE_DIR} PROPERTY INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES)
+# remove root directories, since they contain everything
+list(REMOVE_DUPLICATES include_dirs)
+list(REMOVE_ITEM include_dirs ${tensorflow_source_dir} ${CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR})
+# append core tensorflow header dirs and binary dir where generated headers reside
body: I think this is a superset of the public headers—or at least, I can't see where the filtering happens. Can you try to restrict it to the same set of headers as is installed with the PIP package? (AIUI, you'll also need to install some of the protobuf public headers, if they aren't already installed.)
